title: Yannik Schermer
text: PhD student who is passionate about reproducible data science and data visualization. My research focus is untargeted metabolomics primarily for toxicology and pharmacology. In my free time I like to create stuff with my computer.

title: Yannik Schermer
text:
Education

PhD in Toxicology 2022 - present • RPTU Kaiserslautern-Landau 


M.Sc. in Toxicology 2020 - 2022 • RPTU Kaiserslautern-Landau 


B.Sc. in Food Chemistry 2017 - 2020 • TU Kaiserslautern

title: Yannik Schermer
text:
Experience

Master’s thesis  05/2022 - 10/2022 • Merck KGaA 


more…

Investigated the cardiotoxicity of protein kinase inhibitors using in vitro untargeted proteomics.



Internship  03/2022 - 04/2022 • Merck KGaA 


more…

Laid the ground work for the experiments I performed during my master’s thesis. Mainly did proteomics and programming in R.



Internship  08/2021 - 09/2021 • Merck KGaA 


more…

Established several immunofluorescence methods for the detection of muscle proteins in FFPE rat tissue.



Student assistant  11/2020 - 03/2022 • RPTU Kaiserslautern-Landau 


more…

At the Department for Resource Efficient Wastewater Technology. I mainly performed instrumental analysis of water and literature research on water pollutants.



iGEM competition  11/2019 - 11/2020 • TU Kaiserslautern 


more…

Together with a team I took part in the international 2020 iGEM competition. With our project we won a gold medal, the award for the best environment project and were nominated for two more awards.

title: Yannik Schermer
text:
Conference Contributions
German Pharm-Tox Summit 2024  In vitro Untargeted Metabolomics as a Tool for Mechanistic Studies, Poster
German Society for Environmental Mutation Research Meeting 2024  Untargeted Metabolomics as a Powerful Tool for in vitro Mechanistic Studies, Poster
Young Researchers Symposium RPTU 2024  Untargeted metabolomics for in vitro toxicological testing, Talk

International Conference on Non-Target Screening 2023 Using an in vitro Untargeted Metabolomics Approach for Mechanistic Toxicity Studies, Poster

title: Yannik Schermer
text:
Projects







 prokvis 

Feature-rich and easy to use Shiny app to create intuitive visualizations of bulk kinase data. Species agnostic.

GitHub • ShinyApp








 metamorphr 

R package to make working with metabolomics data more fun by facilitating tidy and streamlined workflows. Developed by me at the Richling lab during my PhD.

GitHub • CRAN








 metamorphrGUI 

Shiny app for the metamorphr package to make it more accessible for people with little or no experience in R. Developed by me at the Richling lab during my PhD.

GitHub • ShinyApp
